comment.body: depends what you do with it, I own rpi zero, rpi 2 to host ownCloud and playing music, while Orange pi has SATA port and built-in storage which is faster than SD card, AFAIK
Thanks, I always looking for opensource software to replace btsync/resilio
我诚邀狗蛋试用一下我建立的代理，https://onlyzero.net

Decoding video stream wont be a problem for rpi or orange pi since hardware-acceleration can be used instead of using CPU only IF the videos are H264 encoded and <=1080p with low bitrates, then it will not be a problem.

The problem is tracking objects and calculating its positions, it seems need lots of cpu power, if so, I am afraid only one is not enough

The good new is depending on your source of videos and how much cpu power needed, maybe you should try run it on Desktop first to see the needs, then consider how much rpi you need

You may consider setting a cluster of rpis
http://makezine.com/projects/build-a-compact-4-node-raspberry-pi-cluster/
to distribute the workload, but pay attention if buying too many rpi maybe not as worthy as buying a new server, or use Cloud service like Google Compute Engine, Amzon EC2 or renting dedicated server
Please share the result of parallel processing,( of cause, if you are allowed and willing to ) I always wonder how it can be applied
I am glad it's developing, looking forward to it !
